Characteristics of Bayesian Networks (1/2)
1. They provide a powerful approach for representing 
probabilistic relationships between attributes and class labels
– They can capture complex forms of dependencies among variables
2. They do not use the naïve Bayes assumption about conditional 
independence
– Thus they can easily handle the presence of correlated or redundant 
attributes
3. Similar to the naïve Bayes classifier, they are also quite robust 
to noise and irrelevant attributes in the training data
– Further, they can handle missing values during training as well as testing
